title: The Handmaid's Tale
author: Margaret Atwood
plot: In a near-future society where women are subjugated, Offred serves as a Handmaid, forced to bear children for elite couples. Her struggle against this oppressive regime leads her to secretly seek freedom and a life beyond her prescribed role.
buzz: A bestseller often studied, it won the Booker Prize in 1986. It's been adapted into a successful series, inspiring discussions about women's rights and control over bodies, making it highly relevant.
matters: With themes of autonomy and resistance, it resonates today amid ongoing debates about women's rights. Its dark humor and chilling scenarios make it both relevant and unsettling.
taste: "We were the people who were not in the papers. We lived in the blank white spaces at the edges of print. It gave us more freedom. We lived in the gaps between the stories."
